content.raw: Would it make sense to create another similarly named function to get the URI with the file path prepended? Alternatively, we can have `Uri` take a bool argument with a default value to specify whether the user wants the text in the `<uri>` tag or the resolved file path, with the default being the text in the `<uri>` tag. I know this means we have to modify ign-gazebo and osrf/gazebo, but I would be okay with that. I just don't know if the DOM object is supposed to be doing these kind of manipulations without being explicitly told to do so.
